ref: Jour: Physical Review, Part C, Nuclear Physics, Vol.85, p.061301 (2012)
title: Gamow-Teller transition strengths in the intermediate nucleus of the 116Cd double-beta decay by the 116Cd(p,n)116In and 116Sn(n,p)116In reactions at 300MeV

nucleus of the 116Cd double-beta decay by the

x4freetext: 295-MeV proton beam at the Research
Center for Nuclear Physics (RCNP) of Osaka University.
(n,p) facility.
Neutron beam at 293 MeV with an intensity of
1E+6 s-1 was produced by using a proton beam with
a current of 300 nA through the 7Li(p,n) reaction.
The experiments were performed at RCNP, Osaka Univ.
under the Experimental Programs No.E272, No.E290.
This work was supported financially in part by a
Grant-in-Aid for Specially Promoted Research
No.17002003 of the Ministry of Education, Culture,
Sports, Science, and Technology of Japan.

x4codes.help: Data correlated with another data set

x4freetext: 116Cd(p,n) reaction data.
M.M.
Request for the data was sent from JCPRG - reply
from Naoya Furutachi 20 August 2012:
"We have already sent a e-mail to the first author
M.Sasano in early August (e-mail in Japanese),
however, we have not received reply yet. Now we are
contacting the coauthor T.Uesaka."
Three enriched 116Sn (99.6%)
target foils with thicknesses of 310+-12, 338+-13,
419+-16 mg/cm2 mounted in a multitarget system.
The spectra obtained over angular range of 0-12 deg
were divided into 12 spectra of double-differential
cross sections in 1 deg bins. The overall energy
resolution was about 2.2 MeV in (n,p) spectra.
By MD analysis, the cross sections are decomposed
into multipole components from changing the angular
momentum dL = 0 to 3.
GT (Gamow-Teller) strengths for the transitions to the
intermediate 1+ states up to 30 MeV in 116In, in the
beta- and beta+ directions via the 116Cd(p,n) and
116Sn(n,p) were obtained.
The strengths integrated up to 30 MeV including the
IVSM component are 40 +-6 and 11 +-1 in the beta- and
beta+ directions, respectively. The GT strength from
the 116Cd ground state to the 116In ground state is
deduced to be 0.28 +-0.03.
Statistical uncertainty
Data are on Fig.1 d,e,f of J,PR/C,85,061301,2012 for
0.7, 4.1, 10.1 deg angles as function of excitation
energy of In-116 (energy bin 1.0 MeV).
